Typealiases.html#/s:9Coviam_NL11HTTPHead.name: HTTPHeaders
Typealiases.html#/s:9Coviam_NL11HTTPHead.abstract: This is a default HTTPHeaders of type Dictionary. [String: String]

Typealiases.html#/s:9Coviam_NL10Paramete.name: Parameters
Typealiases.html#/s:9Coviam_NL10Paramete.abstract: The default Request Parameters of type Dictionary [String: Any]

Structs/URLParameterEncoder.html.name: URLParameterEncoder
Structs/URLParameterEncoder.html.abstract: The Request query parameter encoder which confirms to the ParameterEncoder protocol.

Structs/JSONParameterEncoder.html.name: JSONParameterEncoder
Structs/JSONParameterEncoder.html.abstract: The Request body parameter encoder which confirms to the ParameterEncoder protocol.

Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.name: EndPoint
Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.abstract: The EndPointConfiguration to make sure the request parameters are following the proper protocol mechanism

Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.name: request(_:shouldCache:cacheDuration:completion:)
Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.abstract: The core request method which takes care of returning the data either from the cache or from the origin data source

Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.name: cancelAllRequests()
Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.abstract: The method which cancels all the running tasks for the shared URLSession

Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.name: cancel()
Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html#/s:.abstract: The method which cancels one particular task. You need to have the reference of the NetworkManager to cancel a particular task

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.name: baseURL
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: The baseURL of the request. This parameter will be helpful when we have a environment selection (Dev, QA, PAT, UAT etc)

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.name: path
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: The Url endpoint which should be appended to the baseURL to get the complete Url.

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.name: httpMethod
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: The HTTPMethod. GET / POST / PUT / DELETE etc

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.name: task
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: The DataTasks. This includes the cases with different types of requests.

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.name: headers
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html#/s:.abstract: This is a default HTTPHeaders of type Dictionary. [String: String]

Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html.name: EndPointConfiguration
Protocols/EndPointConfiguration.html.abstract: The Protocol to be confirmed by any URLRequest. The URLRequests to be formed by using this protocol variables. Any APIs or EndPoints passed to the NetworkManager should be confirming to this protocol

Protocols/ParameterEncoder.html.name: ParameterEncoder
Protocols/ParameterEncoder.html.abstract: The ParameterEncoder protocol, to be confirmed by the request and response parameter encoding classes / structs

Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html.name: NetworkRouterProtocol
Protocols/NetworkRouterProtocol.html.abstract: The Protocol to be confirmed by the Network Manager. This will make sure that the Network manager or any other classes which makes use of the Network Manager follows the proper protocol mechanism

Protocols/HomePresenterDelegate.html.name: HomePresenterDelegate
Protocols/HomePresenterDelegate.html.abstract: This protocol is used only for the testing purpose. In the real application, we can use this for more meaningful purpose

Enums/Result.html#/s:9Coviam_NL6ResultO7.name: success
Enums/Result.html#/s:9Coviam_NL6ResultO7.abstract: If the response is successful, the parser will return the Result enum with success case. (Status codes 200 to 299)

Enums/Result.html#/s:9Coviam_NL6ResultO7.name: failure
Enums/Result.html#/s:9Coviam_NL6ResultO7.abstract: The failed response will have the failure case with an associated message. This message can be used to update the user about the actual error

Enums/ParameterEncoding.html#/s:9Coviam_.name: urlAndJsonEncoding
Enums/ParameterEncoding.html#/s:9Coviam_.abstract: Encodes both query parameters and the body parameters of a request

Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO7Course.name: Courses
Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO7Course.abstract: The Courses API. Which follows the CourseModel

Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO10Hacke.name: HackerNews
Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO10Hacke.abstract: The HackerNews API. Which follows the HackerNewsModel

Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO4MockA2.name: Mock
Enums/API.html#/s:9Coviam_NL3APIO4MockA2.abstract: The Mock API. Which follows the MockModel. This is used for the Unit testing purpose

Enums/API.html.name: API
Enums/API.html.abstract: The enum which holds all possible APIs of the Homescreen. Or this can be used to hold all possible APIs of the whole application. This should be confirming to the EndPointConfiguration protocol so as to enable the NetworkManager to make use of it.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html.name: HTTPMethod
Enums/HTTPMethod.html.abstract: Different HTTPMethods supported by the application. Extend this by adding PUT, DELETE and other necessary HTTPMethods

Enums/DataTask.html.name: DataTask
Enums/DataTask.html.abstract: Keeps track of different types of DataTasks needed for the application. Increase number of cases to include the UploadTask, DownloadTask etc based on the requirements

Enums/ParameterEncoding.html.name: ParameterEncoding
Enums/ParameterEncoding.html.abstract: Manages different encoding methods. Extend the cases if more distinct types of encoding is needed

Enums/ResponseMessages.html.name: ResponseMessages
Enums/ResponseMessages.html.abstract: The possible response errors and its corresponding messages. Also use this enum for localizaing the messages shown to the user

Enums/Result.html.name: Result
Enums/Result.html.abstract: The Result enum. Which is used to inform the parser that the API response is successful or not.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: dataTask
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: The dataTask what the -request(_:urlRequest:shouldCache:cacheDuration:completion:) is creating. This variable is used to cancel the particular task as well.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: cache
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: The shared Cache. It uses the default properties for now. The Cache can be extended based on the requirements to support the cache size and cache policy

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: urlRequest
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This variable can be used by the third party frameworks’ dependency Injection which has the request with them and wanted to execute the request through Network Manager

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: request(_:shouldCache:cacheDuration:completion:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: The request method, which first checks whether the request is redundant. If there is already request in progress, the new request will be blocked.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: cacheResponseIfNeeded(_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: The method caches the response in the local cache or in-memory based on the following keys

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: addCacheControlHeader(_:_:_:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method adds the custom expiry time to the response header when caching it locally

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: getModels(from:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: The method which parses the data and supplies the Generic Data Model(s), which can be downcasted by the expected model(s) by the requesting methods of the API

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: handleNetworkResponse(_:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: A private method which check for the response status codes.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: getRequest(from:urlRequest:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: A private method which gives the URL request from the EndPoint. This method will return the URLRequest received from dependency injection if that is not nil.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: configureParameters(bodyParameters:bodyEncoding:urlParameters:request:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method is responsible to configure the parameters to the request of interest.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: addAdditionalHeaders(_:request:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method is responsible to add any additional headers to the request

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: shouldBlockRedundant(api:completion:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method is used to check whether to allow a particular API request or not. The method takes all the running tasks and check whether the new request of interest is already in progress.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: readDataFromCache(forRequest:shouldRead:)
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: Use this method to read the data from cache. If the caching is set to false, return nil data. Else see if the cache is not expired and return the data. If the cache is expired, return nil

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: cancel()
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method is used to cancel the current task which is initiated by the network manager.

Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.name: cancelAllRequests()
Classes/NetworkManager.html#/s:9Coviam_N.abstract: This method is used to cancel all the running and suspended tasks.

Classes/APIHelper.html#/s:9Coviam_NL9API.name: getUrl(pathUrl:)
Classes/APIHelper.html#/s:9Coviam_NL9API.abstract: This method retrieves the Path Url from the plist file

Classes/APIHelper.html#/s:9Coviam_NL9API.name: getCacheDuration()
Classes/APIHelper.html#/s:9Coviam_NL9API.abstract: This method retrieves the Cache Duration configured in the plist file

Classes/APIHelper.html.name: APIHelper
Classes/APIHelper.html.abstract: The helper class which is used to support the NetworkManager or any other Requst related classes

Classes/CourseModel.html.name: CourseModel
Classes/CourseModel.html.abstract: The CourseModel which holds all the expected keys from the response. The model should confirm to the Decodable protocol so that the response can be decoded in a generic way and the Presenter will be able to cast the generic to the CourseModel

Classes/HackerNewsModel.html.name: HackerNewsModel
Classes/HackerNewsModel.html.abstract: The HackerNewsModel which holds all the expected keys from the response. The model should confirm to the Decodable protocol so that the response can be decoded in a generic way and the Presenter will be able to cast the generic to the HackerNewsModel

Classes/MockModel.html.name: MockModel
Classes/MockModel.html.abstract: The MockModel which holds all the expected keys from the response. The model should confirm to the Decodable protocol so that the response can be decoded in a generic way and the Presenter will be able to cast the generic to the MockModel. This Model is used for the Unit Testing purpose

Classes/NetworkManager.html.name: NetworkManager
Classes/NetworkManager.html.abstract: The Network Manager class is responsible for making a Request to the given EndPoint. The class also decides whether to hit the API to get the data or to get the data from the local cache.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
